Set RunAs User

Source: R/content.R
set_run_as.Rd

Set the RunAs user for a piece of content. The run_as_current_user flag only does anything if:

set_run_as(content, run_as, run_as_current_user = FALSE)

Arguments

content

an R6 Content item
run_as

The RunAs user to use for this content
run_as_current_user

Whether to run this content as the viewer of the application

Value

a Content object, updated with new details

Details

  • PAM is the authentication method

  • Applications.RunAsCurrentUser is enabled on the server

Also worth noting that the run_as user must exist on the RStudio Connect server and have appropriate group memberships, or you will get a 400: Bad Request. Set to NULL to use the default RunAs user / unset any current configuration.

To "read" the current RunAs user, use the Content object or get_content() function.

See also

get_content

Other content functions: content_item(), content_title(), dashboard_url_chr(), dashboard_url(), get_acl_user(), get_environment(), get_vanity_url(), set_image_path(), set_vanity_url()
